meanings.sent1: The comparer looked at the two pictures and pointed out the differences.

meanings.definition: To examine the similarities and differences between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: I will comparer the two books to see which one is longer.
meanings.sent2: She likes to comparer prices before making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to comparer their test scores to see who did better.
meanings.sent4: Comparing the two paintings is like trying to find hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: It's important to comparer different options before making a decision.

meanings.definition: To be similar to something else.
meanings.sent1: The new phone model will comparer to the older version in terms of features.
meanings.sent2: Her painting will comparer to a famous artist's work.
meanings.sent3: The cake she baked will comparer to a professional baker's creation.
meanings.sent4: His skills in basketball will comparer to those of a professional player.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset will comparer to a beautiful painting.
